intro: Polycarpaea spirostylis subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth spirea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies glabra is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems, which set it apart from other subspecies of the species. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant produces white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
